thread.title: Espanyol hit back at La Liga over Messi tweet
thread.title_full: Espanyol hit back at La Liga over Messi tweet

title: Espanyol hit back at La Liga over Messi tweet
text:
Espanyol hit back at La Liga over Messi tweet Getty Images 0 Mar 20, 2017 10:34:37 AM Don't forget about the Catalan city's second club, as they burn the League's social media account 
Espanyol have responded sarcastically to the suggestion made by La Liga’s official Twitter account that everyone in Barcelona believes Lionel Messi to be a god. 
The Argentine was on target twice as the Catalans defeated Valencia 4-2 at Camp Nou on Sunday, and the social media account paid tribute to the 29-year-old on Monday morning. 
“In Barcelona, Messi is like a religion,” it offered. No exactamente, amigos de @LaLiga . En Barcelona somos bastante politeistas, ¿saben? #RCDE pic.twitter.com/mPawRmzhnX — RCD ESPANYOL OFICIAL (@RCDEspanyol) March 19, 2017 
Only, they forgot about the city’s other top-flight side, Espanyol, who did not appear too happy with the suggestion that their club heroes were worthless. 
“Not exactly, friends at La Liga. In Barcelona, we are actually quite polytheistic you know!” they prodded back, offering pictures of club legends Raul Tamudo, Maranon, Thomas N’Kono and John Lauridsen. Related
